posts.name: Rick
posts.cooked:
I have an issue getting Photon v2023.1.2. I am using a Limelight 2 with an extra USB Camera. Whenever I plug in the second camera and restart photon vision everything borks and stops working. After reboot,to (un)load the second camera, all my video streams disappear. After some debugging I found out that it involved the second usb camera we used last year(I am testing on the robot of last year). I tested a little with just the limelight as the camera but I wanted to be able to run the second camera as well. Whenever I attach the second camera all my video feeds disappear and the UI is buggy when switching tabs and only load when refreshing the page. from the logs (attached below) I found out that it is detecting 2 extra camera’s instead of 1. I know that there is currently a known bug when using 2 of the same camera’s But I am not I am using 2 different ones but the USB camera is detected twice. Is there a work around so I can start testing with the other camera?

attached some logs and command results:

v4l2-ctl --list-devices

the log
What model is the other camera? May just be one unsupported by cs core.

posts.name: Rick
posts.cooked: It’s an IMX291 wide angle H.264 UVC Video camera and used to work on the Beta versions of the PV. Thanks for the help in advance BTW.

posts.name: Matt
posts.cooked: Looks like CSCore/V4l is unhappy? Which image version was it last known working on? If it was pre beta 7 it was 32-bit… we changed the image quite a bit between betas 6 and 7 iirc, to 64 bit plus libcamera

posts.name: Rick
posts.cooked: I couldn’t tell you which one was the last version. I remember having at least Beta 6 because I had 16h5 tag support but that could well be the latest version I tried.

posts.name: Rick
posts.cooked: I just remembered a thing I tested. I was able to get the camera to work with photon v2023.1.2 when I loaded it up on my laptop.

posts.name: Matt
posts.cooked: What OS is your laptop? I assume windows? Iirc people have had trouble with this camera and a Jetson before, so something in our upgrade to 64 bit Pi OS must have broken it’s v4l driver?

posts.name: Etienne Beaulac
posts.cooked: I think we currently have the same issue. Our wide angle camera works fine in PhotonVision running on a Windows 64-bit laptop, but not on a Raspberry Pi.

Link to camera? H264 cameras most likely will not work well as there seems to have been some regression from when this was fixed.

This is part of the reason why we have recommendations of known working hardware in our documentation, but we will try our best to get this working.

posts.name: Etienne Beaulac
posts.cooked: It is indeed a H.264 USB camera. We’ll try to order a compatible one as listed here .
